50411 Tartu linn,

description.et:
Taimefüsioloogias kasutatavate põhimeetodite teoreetiliste aluste tundmaõppimine ja juhendi järgi nende praktiline rakendamine.

Käsitletavad teemad:
- Ainete absorptsioonispektrid, analüüdi kontsentratsiooni spektrofotomeetriline määramine.
- Aminohapete happelis-aluselised omadused. Puhvrerlahused.
- Valgupuhastamise meetodid
- Ensüümikineetika ja kineetiliste parameetrite määramine
- Taimele iseloomulike ühendite (fenoolsed ühendid, fotosünteesipigmendid) ja ensüümide määramine
- Fotosünteesi, kasvu ning veevahetuse parameetrite (veepotentsiaal, hüdrauliline juhtivus jne.) määramine
- Mulla veemahutavuse ja pH määramine

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give an overview of basic methods used in plant physiology.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda ülevaade põhilistest töövõtetest ja meetoditest taimefüsioloogias.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course, the students are expected:
- to be able to use basic lab equipment used in biochemical experiments.
- to be familiar with basic methods in biochemistry/plant physiology.
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb peamisi laboritöö meetodeid ja nende tööpõhimõtteid.

learning_outcomes.en: - to be able to interpret the results of the experiments and to compose a report.
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab eksperimenditulemusi analüüsida ja tulemuste alusel protokolle vormistada.

description.et: Kõik praktikumitööd peavad olema tehtud ja kõik protokollid esitatud. Võimalikest punktidest (100) peab olema saadud vähemalt 51%

grade_preconditions.et: Students must perform all laboratory works and submit all reports

grade_evaluation.et:
During practical work supervisors will ask questions about the work. If you are prepared and know what you are doing you will get +1 points, if your understanding of the work has significant shortcomings  or you clearly haven't prepared you will get 0 points! As there are 10 tasks you can get up to 10 points.  
The short reports for each experiment MUST be handed in on the next following course-day. If the calculations are correct and the prepared protocol is filled correctly (note on occasion questions may be asked that you need to answer briefly), the protocol will be noted as passed. Each passed protocol can deliver max. 9 credits. If errors occur each protocol can be corrected twice. With every re-submission you lose 2 points of the maximal score.  If the protocols are not handed in on time, 3 credits will be deducted in first week and (-1) per each week the protocol is handed in late.
In order to pass the course, all 10 tasks/experiments have to be conducted. 
All 10 protocols have to be submitted, any un-submitted protocol will prevent passing the course.
In order to pass, 51% of all possibly reachable credits (100) must be gained.

resources.mandatory_materials: practical course manual (will be handed out during the first class, and will be electronically available in Moodle)
